segment.source: Configure Group Policy to Autoenroll and Deploy Certificates (Windows 10)
segment.target: Configure Group Policy to Autoenroll and Deploy Certificates (Windows 10)

segment.source: Configure Group Policy to Autoenroll and Deploy Certificates
segment.target: Configure Group Policy to Autoenroll and Deploy Certificates

segment.source: Configure Group Policy to Autoenroll and Deploy Certificates
segment.target: Configure Group Policy to Autoenroll and Deploy Certificates

segment.source: You can use this procedure to configure Group Policy to automatically enroll client computer certificates and deploy them to the workstations on your network.
segment.target: You can use this procedure to configure Group Policy to automatically enroll client computer certificates and deploy them to the workstations on your network.

segment.source: Follow this procedure for each GPO that contains IPsec connection security rules that require this certificate.
segment.target: Follow this procedure for each GPO that contains IPsec connection security rules that require this certificate.

segment.source: To complete these procedures, you must be a member of both the Domain Admins group in the root domain of your forest and a member of the Enterprise Admins group.
segment.target: To complete these procedures, you must be a member of both the Domain Admins group in the root domain of your forest and a member of the Enterprise Admins group.

segment.source: To configure Group Policy to autoenroll certificates
segment.target: To configure Group Policy to autoenroll certificates

segment.source: Open the Group Policy Management console.
segment.target: Open the Group Policy Management console.

segment.source: In the navigation pane, expand Forest:YourForestName, expand Domains, expand YourDomainName, expand Group Policy Objects, right-click the GPO you want to modify, and then click Edit.
segment.target: In the navigation pane, expand Forest:YourForestName, expand Domains, expand YourDomainName, expand Group Policy Objects, right-click the GPO you want to modify, and then click Edit.

segment.source: In the navigation pane, expand the following path: Computer Configuration, Policies, Windows Settings, Security Settings, Public Key Policies.
segment.target: In the navigation pane, expand the following path: Computer Configuration, Policies, Windows Settings, Security Settings, Public Key Policies.

segment.source: In the Properties dialog box, change Configuration Model to Enabled.
segment.target: In the Properties dialog box, change Configuration Model to Enabled.

segment.source: Select both Renew expired certificates, update pending certificates, and remove revoked certificates and Update certificates that use certificate templates.
segment.target: Select both Renew expired certificates, update pending certificates, and remove revoked certificates and Update certificates that use certificate templates.

segment.source: Click OK to save your changes.
segment.target: Click OK to save your changes.

segment.source: Computers apply the GPO and download the certificate the next time Group Policy is refreshed.
segment.target: Computers apply the GPO and download the certificate the next time Group Policy is refreshed.
